newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING cuts Telegraaf 1997 EPS forecast.
newsitem.headline: ING cuts Telegraaf 1997 EPS forecast.

text.p: Brokerage ING Barings said on Friday it had cut its 1997 earnings per share forecast for Dutch publisher De Telegraaf to 16.25 guilders from 17.00.
ING Barings said this was caused by Thursday's news that De Telegraaf had lost a contract with Dutch broadcaster TROS for which it has been printing TV guides for 30 years.
The contract involves 40 million guilders in turnover, four percent of De Telegraaf's annual sales, and 2.5 percent of the company's total workforce.
"As a result we are recalculating our estimates," ING Barings said in its daily market comment.
The brokerage said the impact would be felt in De Telegraaf's 1997 figures but added it would not be surprised if the publisher launched a new TV guide of its own.
It added it reiterated the stock's Buy recommendation given the low valuation.
ING Barings said De Telegraaf's shares would become very attractive once the stock price came under pressure as a result of losing the TROS contract from 1997.
